The presence of the photograph: The expert's verdict mentions that there is a photograph capturing two men displaying an anti-Semitic sign during a COVID-19 lockdown protest. The existence of the photograph serves as evidence to verify the claim.
Corroborating reports: The expert's verdict refers to Cleveland.com reporting on the image and the anti-Semitic message displayed during the protest. The mention of a reputable news source reporting on the incident adds credibility to the claim.
Social media posts: The expert's verdict mentions that social media posts claimed that a few people in Columbus, Ohio, took advantage of the demonstration to display the anti-Semitic message. The mention of multiple social media posts can serve as additional sources supporting the authenticity of the claim.
Testimony from Ohio state Rep: Casey Weinstein: The expert's verdict includes statements made by Ohio state Rep. Casey Weinstein, who tweeted the photograph and expressed concern about the anti-Semitic message. The inclusion of a public figure's testimony adds weight to the claim's authenticity.
